analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kāśyapa
translated: Just as, O Kāśyapa,

original: glānaḥ puruṣo rājārhan bhaiṣajyam upayujyāsaṃvareṇa kālaṃ kuryāt /
analyzed: glānaḥ puruṣaḥ rājā arhan bhaiṣajyam upayujya a saṃvareṇa kālam kuryāt
translated: a sick person who uses royal medicine and dies due to lack of restraint,

original: evameva kāśyapa bahuśrutasya kleśavyādhiṃ draṣṭavyāḥ yastenāsṃvareṇa kālaṃ karoti /
analyzed: evam eva kāśyapa bahu śrutasya kleśa vyādhim draṣṭavyāḥ yaḥ tena asṃvareṇa kālam karoti
translated: so, O Kāśyapa, the illness of mental afflictions should be seen in the case of the learned one who dies due to lack of restraint.

original: yo rājārhāṃ bhaiṣajyāṃ paryāpunitvā asaṃvareṇa apāyagāmī bhavati /
analyzed: yaḥ rāja arhām bhaiṣajyām paryāpunitvā a saṃvareṇa apāya gāmī bhavati
translated: One who, having obtained royal medicine, goes to the lower realms due to lack of restraint,

original: tatredamucyate //
analyzed: tatra idam ucyate
translated: Regarding this, it is said:

original: yathāpi rājārhaṃ pītva bheṣajaṃ vrajennaro saṃvarato nipātaṃ /
analyzed: yathā api rāja arham pītvā bheṣajam vrajet naraḥ saṃvarataḥ nipātam
translated: Just as a person who drinks royal medicine and dies due to lack of restraint,

original: bahuśrutasyeṣa tu kleśavyādhir yo saṃvareṇeha karoti kālam /
analyzed: bahu śrutasya iṣa tu kleśa vyādhiḥ saṃvareṇa iha karoti kālam
translated: so the illness of mental afflictions is in the case of the learned one who dies here due to lack of restraint.

original: KP / tadyathāpi nāma kāśyapa anarghaṃ vaiḍūryamahāmaṇiratnam uccāre patitam akāryopakaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kāśyapa anargham vaiḍūrya mahā maṇi ratnam uccāre patitam a kārya upakam bhavati
translated: Just as, O Kāśyapa, an invaluable great precious gem of beryl that has fallen into the toilet is useless,

original: evameva kāśyapa bahuśrutasya lābhasatkārauccārapatanaṃ draṣṭavya /
analyzed: evam eva kāśyapa bahu śrutasya lābha satkāra auccāra patanam
translated: so, O Kāśyapa, the fall into the toilet of gain and honor should be seen in the case of the learned one.🔽Here it is said:

original: niṣkiñcanaṃ devamanuṣyeṣu /
analyzed: niṣkiñcanam deva manuṣyeṣu
translated: He is without possessions among gods and humans.

original: tatredamucyate //
analyzed: tatra idam ucyate
translated: Regarding this, it is said:

original: ratnaṃ yathoccāragataṃ juguspitaṃ yathā syānna tathā yathā pura /
analyzed: ratnam yathā uccāra gatam juguspitam yathā syāt na tathā yathā
translated: Just as a jewel that has fallen into an outhouse is not considered valuable, but is still a jewel,

original: bahuśrutasyāpi vadāmi bhikṣoḥ satkāramīḍe patanaṃ tatheva /
analyzed: bahu śrutasya api vadāmi bhikṣoḥ satkāram īḍe patanam tathā iva
translated: so it is with the praise of a monk who is very learned, but has fallen due to desire for gain.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kāśyapā tadeva vaiḍūryaṃ mahāmaṇiratnam ameddhyāvaskarāduddhṛtaṃ bhavet suddhautaṃ suprakṣālitaṃ suparimārjitaṃ /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kāśyapa tat eva vaiḍūryam mahā maṇi ratnam ameddhyā avaskarāt uddhṛtam bhavet su dhautam su prakṣālitam su parimārjitam
translated: Just as that very vaiḍūrya gem, O Kāśyapa, when taken out of the heap of filth, is well-washed, well-cleaned, well-polished,

original: taṃ maṇiratnasvabhāvam eva na vijahatyevameva kāśyapa bahuśruto 'lpaprayatnena sarvakleśān viśodhayati mahāprajñāratnasvabhāvam eva na vijahāti
analyzed: tam maṇi ratna svabhāvam eva na vijahati evam eva kāśyapa bahu śrutaḥ lpa prayatnena sarva kleśān viśodhayati mahā prajñā ratna svabhāvam eva na vijahāti
translated: it does not abandon its nature as a precious gem, in the same way, O Kāśyapa, the very learned one, with little effort, purifies all the afflictions and does not abandon his nature as a precious gem of great wisdom.

original: KP / tadyathāpi nāma kāśyapa mṛtakasya śirasi suvarṇamālā /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kāśyapa mṛtakasya śirasi suvarṇa mālā
translated: Just as, O Kāśyapa, a golden necklace on the head of a dead person,

original: evameva kāśyapa duḥśīlasya kāṣāyadhāraṇaṃ draṣṭavyaṃ /
analyzed: evam eva kāśyapa duḥśīlasya kāṣāya dhāraṇam draṣṭavyam
translated: in the same way, O Kāśyapa, the wearing of the saffron robes by one of bad character should be seen.

original: tatredamucyate / //
analyzed: tatra idam ucyate  /
translated: Regarding this, it is said:

original: suvarṇamāleva mṛtasya śīrṣe nyastā yathā syād atha puṣpamālā
analyzed: suvarṇa mālā iva mṛtasya śīrṣe nyastā yathā syāt atha puṣpa mālā
translated: Just as a golden necklace or a flower garland placed on the head of a dead person,

original: kāṣāyavastrāṇi tathā viśīle dṛṣṭvā 'nna kuryān manasaḥ pradoṣāṃ //
analyzed: kāṣāya vastrāṇi tathā viśīle dṛṣṭvā na kuryāt manasaḥ
translated: so should one see the saffron robes on one of bad character, and not be angry in one's mind.

original: KP / tadyathāpi nāma kāśyapa avadātavas / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / sya pravaracandanānuliptasya śreṣṭhiputrasya vā rājaputrasya vā
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kāśyapa pravara candana anuliptasya śreṣṭhi putrasya vā rāja putrasya vā
translated: Just as, O Kashyapa, if a person anointed with the best sandalwood were to embrace a person smeared with excrement, the one anointed with sandalwood would not think, Let me smell like this, but the one smeared with excrement would think, Let me smell like that. In the same way, O Kashyapa, the bodhisattva who is anointed with the sandalwood of compassion does not think, Let me be defiled by the excrement of sentient beings, but the sentient beings who are smeared with the excrement of defilements think, Let us be like him.

original: śirasi campakamālābaddhaṃ bhavet /
analyzed: śirasi campaka mālā baddham bhavet
translated: Just as, O Kāśyapa, for a well-bathed and anointed merchant's son or prince, a garland of campaka flowers would be bound on his head,

original: evam e / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / lavato bahuśrutasya kāṣāyadhāraṇaṃ draṣṭavyaḥ tatredamucyate //🔽susnātasyānuliptasya śreṣṭhiputrasya śobhe X
analyzed: evam lavataḥ bahu śrutasya kāṣāya dhāraṇam draṣṭavyaḥ tatra idam ucyate  su snātasya anuliptasya śreṣṭhi putrasya śobhe x
translated: in the same way, O Kāśyapa, the wearing of the saffron robes by the one who has gone forth should be seen as a garland of campaka flowers. Regarding this, it is said:🔽For a well-bathed and anointed merchant's son, the beauty

original: XXX mpakāmāleva śubhagandhā manoramāṃ
analyzed: śubha gandhā manoramām

analyzed: yathā tathā iva kāṣāyam saṃvara sthe bahuśrute

analyzed: draṣṭavyam śīla sampanna guṇa anvite

original: KP / catvāra ime kāśyapa duḥśīlā śīlavantapratirūpakāḥ katame catvāraḥ iha kāśyapa e / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / tyo bhikṣuḥ prātimokṣasaṃvarasaṃvṛto
analyzed: catvāraḥ ime kāśyapa katame catvāraḥ iha kāśyapa

original: viharati /
analyzed: viharati
translated: observing and practicing the training rules, seeing danger in the slightest faults.

original: ācāragocarasampanna aṇumātreṣvavadyeṣu bhayadarśī samā / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / ya śikṣate śikṣāpadeṣu /

translated: He who is endowed with conduct and resort, who sees danger in the slightest faults, who is fully restrained in body, speech, and mind, who trains in the precepts,

original: pariśuddhakāyakarmavāṅmanaskarmaṇā samanvāgato viharati /
analyzed: pariśuddha kāya karma vāc manaḥ karmaṇā samanvāgataḥ viharati
translated: who dwells endowed with pure bodily, verbal, and mental actions,

original: pariśuddhājīvaḥ sa ca bha / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / tyātmavādī ayam kāśyapa prathamo duḥśīlaḥ śīlavantaḥpratirūpako draṣṭavyaḥ //
analyzed: pariśuddha ājīvaḥ sa ca ayam kāśyapa prathamaḥ duḥśīlaḥ śīlavantaḥ pratirūpakaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: who has a pure livelihood, and who proclaims himself to be such - this, Kāśyapa, is the first one who is immoral, to be seen as a counterfeit of those with moral discipline.

original: punar aparaṃ kāśyapa ihekatyo bhikṣurvinayadharo bhavati /
analyzed: punar aparam kāśyapa iha ekatyaḥ bhikṣuḥ vinaya dharaḥ bhavati
translated: Moreover, Kāśyapa, here a certain monk is a master of the Vinaya.

original: pravartavinayo vinayaguptiḥpratiṣṭhitaḥ satkāyadṛṣṭirasyānucalitā bhavati /
analyzed: pravarta vinayaḥ vinaya guptiḥ pratiṣṭhitaḥ satkāyadṛṣṭiḥ asya anucalitā bhavati
translated: He is skilled in the Vinaya, established in the protection of the Vinaya, but his view of the real existence of the self is not shaken.

original: ayaṃ kāśyapa dvitīyo duḥśīlaḥ śīlavantaḥpratirūpakaḥ //
analyzed: ayam kāśyapa dvitīyaḥ duḥśīlaḥ śīlavantaḥ pratirūpakaḥ
translated: This, Kāśyapa, is the second one who is immoral, to be seen as a counterfeit of those with moral discipline.

original: punaraparaṃ kāśyapa ihekatyo bhikṣuḥ maitrāvihāri bhavati sattvā / / / / / / / / / / / / / ṇayā samanvāgataḥ sa ca ajāti sarvvadharmāṇāṃ śrutvā utrasati🔽santrasati /
analyzed: punar aparam kāśyapa iha ikatyaḥ bhikṣuḥ maitrāvihāri bhavati sattvāḥ samanvāgataḥ sa ca ajāti sarvva dharmāṇām śrutvā utrasati  santrasati
translated: Moreover, Kāśyapa, here a certain monk dwells in loving-kindness, endowed with the equanimity of beings, but having heard of the non-arising of all dharmas, he trembles🔽and is terrified.

original: santrāsamāpadyate /
analyzed: santrāsam āpadyate
translated: He falls into terror.

original: ayaṃ kāśyapa tṛtīyo duḥśīlaḥ śīlavantaḥpratirūpakaḥ //
analyzed: ayam kāśyapa tṛtīyaḥ duḥśīlaḥ śīlavantaḥ pratirūpakaḥ
translated: This, Kāśyapa, is the third immoral one who resembles the moral one.🔽Moreover, Kāśyapa, here some monk, having attained the twelve dhūta ascetic practices, is one who has attained the twelve dhūta ascetic practices, but he is one who has a view of grasping, and he abides in a sense of self. This, Kāśyapa, is the fourth immoral one who resembles the moral one.

original: punaraparaṃ kāśyapa ihekatyo bhikṣuḥ dvādaśadhutaguṇasa / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / upalambhadṛṣṭikaśca bhavatyahaṅkārasthitaḥ ayaṃ kāśyapa caturtho duḥśīlaḥ🔽dra / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / pa catvāro duḥlā śīlavantapratirūpakā draṣṭavyāḥ //🔽KP / śīlam śīlam iti kāśyapa ucyate /🔽yatra nātma / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / nātmīya na sattvo na sattvaprajñaptiḥ na kriyā nākriyā /🔽na karaṇaṃ nākaraṇaṃ /🔽cāro nācāraḥ na pracā / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / nāpracāraḥ na nāmaṃ na rūpa /🔽nimittaṃ nānimittaṃ /
analyzed: punar aparam kāśyapa iha ikatyaḥ bhikṣuḥ upalambha dṛṣṭikaḥ ca bhavati ahaṅkāra sthitaḥ ayam kāśyapa caturthaḥ duḥśīlaḥ  catvāraḥ draṣṭavyāḥ  śīlam śīlam iti kāśyapaḥ ucyate  yatra na sattvaḥ na sattva prajñaptiḥ na kriyā na akriyā  na karaṇam na akaraṇam  cāraḥ na ācāraḥ na pracā na apracāraḥ na na  nimittam na animittam
translated: These, Kāśyapa, are the four immoral ones who resemble the moral ones that should be seen.

original: na śamo napraśamaḥ na grāho notsargaḥ na grāhyaṃ / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / hya /
analyzed: na śamaḥ na praśamaḥ na grāhaḥ na utsargaḥ na grāhyam

original: na sattvo na sattvaprajñaptiḥ na vāṅ na vākprajñapti na cittaṃ na cittaprajñaptiḥ na loko nālokaḥ na niśrayo nāniśrayaḥ nā maśīlotkarṣaṇā /
analyzed: na sattvaḥ na sattva prajñaptiḥ na vāc na vāc prajñapti na cittam na citta prajñaptiḥ na lokaḥ na alokaḥ na niśrayaḥ na aniśrayaḥ na ā ma śīla utkarṣaṇā
translated: There is no being, no designation of a being; no speech, no designation of speech; no mind, no designation of mind; no world, no non-world; no support, no non-support; no praising one's own moral discipline,

original: na paraduḥśīlapaṃsanā /🔽na śīlamanyanā /
analyzed: na para duḥśīla paṃsanā  na śīla manyanā
translated: no disparaging the bad moral discipline of others.🔽No conceiving of moral discipline,

original: na śīlakalpanā /🔽vikalpanā /
analyzed: na śīla kalpanā  vikalpanā
translated: no imagining of moral discipline,🔽no conceptualizing,

original: na saṅkalpanā na parikalpanā /
analyzed: na saṅkalpanā na parikalpanā
translated: no intention, no postulation.

original: iyamucyate kāśyapa āryāṇā śīla /
analyzed: iyam ucyate kāśyapaḥ āryāṇā śīla
translated: This, Kāśyapa, is called the moral discipline of the noble ones.

original: anāsravam aparyāpannaṃ traidhātukānu gataṃ sarvaniśrayāpagaṃ /
analyzed: anāsravam a paryāpannam traidhātuka anu gatam sarva niśraya āpagam
translated: It is undefiled, unattached, not gone to the three realms, free from all dependence.

analyzed: atha bhagavān tasyām velāyam imām gāthām a bhāṣataḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke this verse on that occasion:

original: na śīlavantasya m / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / na kiñcana
analyzed: na śīlavantasya m na kiñcana
translated: For one with moral discipline, there is nothing at all...

original: na śīlavantasya mado na niśrayaḥ🔽na śīlavantasya tamo na bandhanam /
analyzed: na śīlavantasya madaḥ na niśrayaḥ  na śīlavantasya tamaḥ na bandhanam
translated: For one with moral discipline, there is no pride, no dependence,🔽For one with moral discipline, there is no darkness, no bondage.

original: na śīlavantasya rajo na / / / / / / / / / / / / / / /
analyzed: na śīlavantasya rajaḥ na
translated: For one with moral discipline, there is no dust, no...

original: śāntapraśānta upaśāntamānaso
analyzed: śānta praśāntaḥ upaśānta mānasaḥ
translated: With a mind peaceful, calm, and tranquil,

original: kalpaḥ vikalpāpagato niraṅgaṇaḥ
analyzed: kalpaḥ vikalpa apagataḥ niraṅgaṇaḥ
translated: Free from conceptualization and discrimination, free from defilements,

original: sarveñjanāmanyanavipramuktaḥ
analyzed: sarva iñjana āmanyana vipramuktaḥ
translated: Liberated from all agitation, conceiving, and discrimination,

original: XśiXX n kāśyapa buddhaśāsaneḥ
analyzed: n kāśyapa buddha śāsaneḥ
translated: The Buddha's teachings, Kāśyapa,

original: na kāyasāvekṣi na jīvitārthiko
analyzed: na
translated: Not concerned with the body, not seeking wealth,

original: hyanarthikaḥ sarvabhavopapattibhiḥ
analyzed: hi anarthikaḥ sarva bhava upapattibhiḥ
translated: He has no need for any rebirth in existence,

original: samyaggat / ḥ s / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / pratiṣṭhitaḥ
analyzed: samyaggat ḥ s pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: He is well-gone, well-abiding, well-departed,

original: sa śīlavān kāśyapa buddhaśāsane /
analyzed: sa śīlavān kāśyapa buddha śāsane
translated: He is one of moral conduct in the Buddha's teachings,

original: na lokalipto na ca lokaniśritoḥ
analyzed: na loka liptaḥ na ca
translated: Not smeared by the world, not dependent on the world,

original: ālokaprāpto amamo / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / ñcanaḥ
analyzed: āloka prāptaḥ a mamaḥ ñ canaḥ
translated: Having attained light, free from possessions,

original: na cātmasañjñī na pareṣu sañjñī
analyzed: na ca ātma sañjñī na pareṣu sañjñī
translated: Not conceiving of self, not conceiving of others,

original: sañjñā parijñāya viśuddhaśīlaḥ
analyzed: sañjñā parijñāya viśuddha śīlaḥ
translated: Having fully understood conception, pure in morality,

original: yasyā napāraṃ na ca pāramadhy /
analyzed: yasyāḥ na pāram na ca pāram adhi
translated: For whom there is no far shore, no near shore,

original: X pārapāre ca na jātu saktaḥ
analyzed: pāra pāre ca na jātu saktaḥ
translated: No attachment to the far shore or near shore,

original: avabaddhāsakto akuho anāsravaḥ
analyzed: avabaddha āsaktaḥ a kuhaḥ an āsravaḥ
translated: Unbound, unattached, guileless, without defilements,

original: sa śīlavān kāśyapa buddhaśāsane /
analyzed: sa śīlavān kāśyapa buddha śāsane
translated: He is one of moral conduct in the Buddha's teachings,

original: KP / nāme ca rūpe ca asaktamānasaḥ samāhitasso hi sudāntacittaḥ
analyzed: nāme ca rūpe ca asakta mānasaḥ samāhitaḥ saḥ hi su dānta cittaḥ
translated: With a mind unattached to names and forms, he is indeed well-concentrated with a well-tamed mind.

original: yasyeha ātmā na ca ātmanīyām etāvatā śīlasthito nirucyate /
analyzed: yasya iha ātmā na ca ātmanīyām etāvatā śīla sthitaḥ nirucyate
translated: For whom there is no self and nothing pertaining to a self, to this extent he is said to abide in morality.

original: na śikṣayā manyati prātimokṣe na cāpi tena bhavateha tanmayo /
analyzed: na śikṣayā manyati prātimokṣe na ca api tena bhavatā iha
translated: He does not think highly of the Prātimokṣa training, nor does he become absorbed in it.

original: athottaraṃ margati āryamārge viśuddhaśīlasya ime nimittā
analyzed: atha uttaram margati ārya mārge viśuddha śīlasya ime nimittā
translated: But he seeks the noble path, these are the signs of one with pure morality.

original: na śīlaparamo na samādhitannmayoḥ paryeṣate duttari prajñābhāvanā /
analyzed: na śīla paramaḥ na paryeṣate duttari prajñā bhāvanā
translated: Not being one who takes morality as supreme, not absorbed in concentration, he seeks the higher training in wisdom.

original: anopalambham āryāṇa gotraṃ viśuddhaśīla sugataṃ praśastam /
analyzed: anopalambham āryāṇa gotram viśuddha śīla sugatam praśastam
translated: The lineage of the noble ones is non-apprehension, pure morality praised by the Sugata.

original: satkāyadṛṣṭe hi vimuktamānaso ahaṃ mamaitīha na tasya bhoti /
analyzed: sat kāya dṛṣṭe hi vimukta mānasaḥ aham mama eti iha na tasya
translated: One whose mind is liberated from the view of the real existence of the body does not have here 'I' and 'mine'.

original: adhimucyate śūnyatabuddhagocaramm imasya śīlasya samo na vidyate /
analyzed: adhimucyate śūnyata buddha gocaram imasya śīlasya samaḥ na vidyate
translated: One has faith in the domain of the Buddha's wisdom of emptiness. There is no equal to this morality.

original: śīle pratiṣṭhāya samādhi śuddhaḥ samādhiprāptasya ca prajñabhāvanā /
analyzed: śīle pratiṣṭhāya samādhi śuddhaḥ samādhi prāptasya ca prajña bhāvanā
translated: Having established oneself in morality, concentration is pure. And for one who has attained concentration, the cultivation of wisdom.

original: prajñāya jñānaṃ bhavate viśuddhaṃ viśuddhajñānasya ca śīlasampadā / //
analyzed: prajñāya jñānam bhavate viśuddham viśuddha jñānasya ca śīla sampadā
translated: From wisdom, knowledge becomes pure. And for one of pure knowledge, there is the perfection of morality.

original: KP / asmin khalu punargāthābhinirhāre bhāṣyamāṇe aṣṭānāṃ bhikṣuśatānām anupādāyāsravebhyaścittāni vimuktāni /
analyzed: asmin khalu punar gāthā abhinirhāre bhāṣyamāṇe aṣṭānām bhikṣu śatānām an upādāya āsravebhyaḥ cittāni vimuktāni
translated: And when this verse was being recited, the minds of eight hundred monks were liberated from the defilements without further appropriation.

original: dvātriṃśatināṃ ca prāṇasahasrāṇāṃ virajo vigatamalaṃ dharmeṣu dharmacakṣurviśuddhaṃ /
analyzed: dvātriṃśatinām ca prāṇa sahasrāṇām virajaḥ vigata malam dharmeṣu dharma cakṣuḥ viśuddham
translated: And the Dharma-eye, dust-free and unblemished, regarding phenomena arose in thirty-two thousand beings.

original: pañca bhikṣuśatāni dhyānalābhī uthāyāsanebhyaḥ prakrāntāni imāṃ gambhīrā dharmadeśanām avataranto nāvagāhamānāḥ anadhimucyamānāḥ
analyzed: pañca bhikṣu śatāni dhyāna lābhī uthāya āsanebhyaḥ prakrāntāni imām gambhīrāḥ dharma deśanām avatarantaḥ na avagāhamānāḥ an adhimucyamānāḥ
translated: Five hundred monks who had attained the meditative absorptions rose from their seats and departed, not penetrating, not fathoming, and not having confidence in this profound teaching of the Dharma.

original: KP / athāyuṣmān mahākāśyapo bhagavantam etadavocat imāni bhagavan pañca bhikṣuṣatāni dhyānalābhīnyutthāyāsanebhyaḥ prakrāntāni /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān mahākāśyapaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat imāni bhagavan pañca bhikṣuṣatāni dhyāna lābhīni utthāya āsanebhyaḥ prakrāntāni
translated: Then the Venerable Mahakasyapa said this to the Blessed One: These five bhikṣus, Blessed One, who have attained dhyāna, have risen from their seats and departed,

original: imām gambhīrā dharmadeśanām avataranto nāvagāhanto manadhimucyamānāḥ bhagavān āha /
analyzed: imām gambhīrāḥ dharma deśanām avatarantaḥ na avagāhantaḥ bhagavān āha
translated: not penetrating, not fathoming, not being convinced of this profound teaching of the Dharma. The Blessed One said:

original: tathā hyete kāśyapa bhikṣuvaḥ anadhimānite manadhimucyamānā imāṃ gambhīrā gāthābhinirhārām
analyzed: tathā hi ete kāśyapa bhikṣuvaḥ an adhimānite imām gambhīrāḥ gāthā abhinirhārām
translated: Thus, indeed, these bhikṣus, Kāśyapa, being without conceit, not being convinced, of this profound utterance of verse,

original: anāsravaṃ śīlaviśuddhinirdeśaṃ śrutvā nāvataranti nādhimucyanti nāvagāhanti tatkasmāddheto
analyzed: anāsravam śīla viśuddhi nirdeśam śrutvā na avataranti na adhimucyanti na avagāhanti tat kasmāt hetoḥ
translated: having heard the teaching on the purity of undefiled morality, do not penetrate, are not convinced, do not fathom. Why is that?

original: gambhīro yaṃ kāśyapa gāthābhinirhāraṃ gambhīraṃ buddhā bhagavantānāṃ bodhi sā na
analyzed: gambhīraḥ yam kāśyapa gāthā abhinirhāram gambhīram buddhāḥ bhagavantānām bodhi sā na
translated: The profound, Kāśyapa, is the utterance of verse, the profound is the enlightenment of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones,

original: śakyam anavaropitakuśalamūle pāpamatraparigṛhīteranadhimuktibahule sattvairadhimucyituṃ
analyzed: śakyam an avaropita kuśala mūle pāpa matra parigṛhīteḥ anadhimukti bahule sattvaiḥ adhimucyitum
translated: it is not possible for beings who have not planted wholesome roots, who are seized by evil, who are not abundant in conviction, to be convinced of it,

original: vā paryapanituṃ vā avatarituṃ vā /
analyzed: vā paryapanitum vā avataritum vā
translated: or to investigate it, or to penetrate it.

original: KP / api ca kāśyapa etāni pañca bhikṣuśatāni kāśyapasya tathāgatasyārhata samyaksambuddhasya pravacane anyatīrthikaśrāvakā abhūvan /
analyzed: api ca kāśyapa etāni pañca bhikṣu śatāni kāśyapasya tathāgatasya arhata samyaksambuddhasya pravacane anya tīrthika śrāvakāḥ abhūvan
translated: Moreover, Kāśyapa, these five hundred monks were disciples of other tīrthikas in the teaching of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Kāśyapa.

original: ste kāśyapasya tathāgatasyāntikāduparambhābhiprāyairekā dharmadeśanā śrutvā śrutvā🔽ceva cittaprasādo labdha āścāryaṃ yāvanmadhurapriyabhākhalveyaṃ kāśyapastathāgato
analyzed: ste kāśyapasya tathāgatasya antikāt uparambha abhiprāyaiḥ ekā dharma deśanā śrutvā śrutvā  ca iva citta prasādaḥ labdhaḥ āścāryam yāvat madhura priya bhā khalveyam kāśyapaḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: With the intention of finding fault, they listened to a single Dharma teaching from the Tathāgata Kāśyapa. Having listened,

original: 'rhāṃ saṃyaksambuddha iti /
analyzed: rhām saṃyaksambuddhaḥ iti
translated: they obtained faith in their minds and thought, How wonderful! The Tathāgata Kāśyapa, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, is so sweet-sounding and pleasant-spoken.

original: te tataścyutasamānā ekacittaprasādena kālagatāḥ trāyastriṃśeṣu deveṣūpapannāḥ neva
analyzed: te tatas cyuta samānāḥ eka citta prasādena kālagatāḥ trāyastriṃśeṣu deveṣu upapannāḥ na iva
translated: They died with that single faith and were reborn among the Thirty-Three gods.

original: hetunā iha mamma śāsane pravrajitāḥ tānyetāni kāśyapa pañca bhikṣuśatāni dṛṣṭigatapraskanditāni
analyzed: hetunā iha mamma śāsane pravrajitāḥ tāni etāni kāśyapa pañca bhikṣu śatāni dṛṣṭi gata praskanditāni
translated: By that cause, they went forth in my teaching here. Those five hundred monks, Kāśyapa, were attached to wrong views.

original: imāṃ gambhīrā dharmadeśanā nāvataranti nāvagāhanti nādhimucyante na śraddadhanti /
analyzed: imām gambhīrāḥ dharma deśanāḥ na avataranti na avagāhanti na adhimucyante na śraddadhanti
translated: They did not enter, did not penetrate, did not believe, and did not have faith in this profound teaching of the Dharma.

original: kṛtaṃ punareṣā m / / / / yaṃ dharmadeśanāyā parikarma na bhūyo vinipātagāmino bhaviṣyanti /
analyzed: kṛtam punar eṣā yam dharma deśanāyā parikarma na bhūyas vinipāta gāminaḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: But they did perform the preliminary work for this teaching of the Dharma, and they will not go to the lower realms again.

original: ebhireva skandhaiḥ parinirvāsyanti / //
analyzed: ebhiḥ eva skandhaiḥ parinirvāsyanti
translated: they will attain final nirvāṇa through these very aggregates.”

original: KP / tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtim āmantrayati sma /
analyzed: tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantam subhūtim āmantrayati sma
translated: There the Blessed One addressed the Venerable Subhūti:

original: gacchastvaṃsubhūte etān bhikṣu sañjñapaya subhūtirāha /
analyzed: gacchaḥ tvam subhūte etān bhikṣu sañjñapaya subhūtiḥ āha
translated: “Go, Subhūti, and admonish those monks.” Subhūti said:

original: bhagavata eva tāvadete bhikṣavo bhāṣitaṃ prativilomayanti kaḥ punarvādo mama /🔽atha khalu bhagavāṃstasyāṃ velāyā yena mārgeṇa te bhikṣavo gacchanti sma /
analyzed: bhagavataḥ eva tāvat ete bhikṣavaḥ bhāṣitam prativilomayanti kaḥ punar vādaḥ mama  atha khalu bhagavān tasyām velāyāḥ yena mārgeṇa te bhikṣavaḥ gacchanti sma
translated: “Those monks are already contradicting what the Blessed One has said, so what need is there to speak of me?”

original: tasminmārge dvau bhikṣu nirmimīte sma /
analyzed: tasmin mārge dvau bhikṣu nirmimīte sma
translated: Then the Blessed One, on that occasion, manifested two monks on the path by which those monks were going.

original: atha tāni pañca bhikṣuśatāni yena mārgeṇa tau dvau bhikṣu nirmito tenopasaṅkrāmannupasaṅkramyevamavocan /
analyzed: atha tāni pañca bhikṣu śatāni yena mārgeṇa tau dvau bhikṣu tena upasaṅkrāman upasaṅkramya evam avocan
translated: Then those five hundred monks, having approached by that path where those two monks had been manifested, having approached, spoke thus:

original: kutra āyuṣmanto gamiṣyathaḥ tāvavocatāḥ gamiṣyāma vayam araṇyāyataneṣu sukhaṃ phāṣaṃ
analyzed: kutra āyuṣmantaḥ gamiṣyathaḥ tau avocatāḥ gamiṣyāma vayam araṇya āyataneṣu sukham
translated: “Where are the Venerable Ones going?” They said: “We are going to dwell happily in the seclusion of the forest.”

original: vihariṣyāmaḥ tatkasmāddhetoryaṃ hi bhagavān dharmaṃ deśayati tāmāvā dharmadeśanāṃ
analyzed: vihariṣyāmaḥ tat kasmāt hetoḥ yam hi bhagavān dharmam deśayati tām āvā dharma deśanām
translated: Why is that? Because the Dharma teaching that the Blessed One teaches

original: nāvarāvo nāvagāhāma he /🔽nadhimucyāvahe /
analyzed: na avarāvaḥ na avagāhāma he  na adhimucyāvahe
translated: we do not understand, we do not penetrate.

original: utrasivaḥ santrasāvaḥ santrāsamāpadyāmahe /
analyzed: utrasivas santrasāvaḥ santrāsam āpadyāmahe
translated: We are frightened, terrified, and filled with fear.

original: tāvāvām āraṇyāyataneṣu sukhaṃ vihariṣyāmaḥ
analyzed: tau āvām āraṇya āyataneṣu sukham vihariṣyāmaḥ
translated: We two will happily dwell in the forest hermitages.

original: KP / tānyapi pañca bhikṣuśatānyetad avocan /
analyzed: tāni api pañca bhikṣu śatāni etat avocan
translated: Those five hundred monks also said this:

original: vayam apyāyuṣmanto bhagavato dharmadeśanā nāvatarāmo nāvagāhāmahe nādhimucyāmahe /
analyzed: vayam api āyuṣmantaḥ bhagavataḥ dharma deśanāḥ na avatarāmaḥ na avagāhāmahe na adhimucyāmahe
translated: Venerable ones, we also do not understand, do not penetrate, and do not have faith in the Blessed One's teaching of the Dharma.

original: utrasāvaḥ santrasāvaḥ santrāsam āpadyāmahe /
analyzed: utrasāvaḥ santrasāvaḥ santrāsam āpadyāmahe
translated: We are afraid, terrified, and filled with dread.

original: te vayam araṇyāyaneṣu dhyānasukhavihārairvihariṣyāmaḥ nirmitakāvavocatā saṅgāyiṣyāma
analyzed: te vayam araṇya ayaneṣu dhyāna sukha vihāraiḥ vihariṣyāmaḥ nirmitakau avocatā saṅgāyiṣyāma
translated: We will dwell in the forest hermitages in the bliss of meditation. The two created monks said, We will recite together.

original: vayam āyuṣmanto na vivadiṣyāmaḥ avivāda paramo hi śramaṇadharmaḥ yadiha māyuṣmanta
analyzed: vayam āyuṣmantaḥ na vivadiṣyāmaḥ a vivāda paramaḥ hi śramaṇa dharmaḥ yat iha
translated: Venerable ones, we will not dispute. For the supreme Dharma of ascetics is non-disputation. If here, venerable ones,

original: ityucyate parinirvāṇam iti /
analyzed: iti ucyate parinirvāṇam iti
translated: it is said 'nirvana,'

original: katamaḥ sa dharmo yaḥ pari / / / / / / / / / / / / / / syati kaścit punarasmiṃ kaye ātmā vā sattvo
analyzed: katamaḥ sa dharmaḥ yaḥ pari syati kaścid punar asmin kaye ātmā vā sattvaḥ
translated: what is that dharma which is to be completely extinguished? Is there in this body a self, a being,

original: vā jīvo vā janturvā pauṣau vā pudgalo vā manujo vā mānavo / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / kartā
analyzed: vā jīvaḥ vā jantuḥ vā pauṣau vā pudgalaḥ vā manujaḥ vā kartā
translated: a life-force, a creature, a person, an individual, a human, a human being, an agent,

original: vā kārako vā vedako vā jānako vā sañjānako vā utthāpako vā samutthāpako vā yaḥ parinirvāsyati /
analyzed: vā kārakaḥ vā vedakaḥ vā jānakaḥ vā sañjānakaḥ vā utthāpakaḥ vā samutthāpakaḥ vā yaḥ parinirvāsyati
translated: or a cause, a feeler, a knower, a fully conscious one, an instigator, or an instigator of instigation, who is to be completely extinguished?🔽No, venerable ones.

original: KP / te āhu / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / na kvacidasti /
analyzed: te āhuḥ na kvacid asti
translated: They said: We do not see any such thing anywhere.

original: asmiṃ kāye ātmā vā sattvo vā jīvo vā janturvā puruṣo vā pudgalo vā manujo vā mānavo vā kartā vā kārako vā vedako vā jānako vā sañjānako vā
analyzed: asmin kāye ātmā vā sattvaḥ vā jīvaḥ vā jantuḥ vā puruṣaḥ vā pudgalaḥ vā manujaḥ vā mānavaḥ vā kartā vā kārakaḥ vā vedakaḥ vā jānakaḥ vā sañjānakaḥ vā
translated: In this body there is no self, no sentient being, no life-force, no living being, no person, no human, no human being, no agent, or one who acts, or one who feels, or one who knows, or one who perceives,

original: utthāpako vā yaḥ parinirvāsyati /
analyzed: utthāpakaḥ vā yaḥ parinirvāsyati
translated: or one who causes, or one who will attain final nirvāṇa.

original: nirmitakā prāhu /
analyzed: prāhu
translated: The emanations said:

original: X puna sākṣīkṛyāyā parinirvāsyatīti /
analyzed: punar sākṣīkṛyāyā parinirvāsyati iti
translated: Will you attain final nirvāṇa by making a witness?

original: te āhuḥ rāgakṣayāya dveṣakṣayāya mohakṣayāya āyuṣmanta parinirvāṇam iti /
analyzed: te āhuḥ rāga kṣayāya dveṣa kṣayāya moha kṣayāya āyuṣmanta parinirvāṇam iti
translated: They said: Venerable ones, final nirvāṇa is for the destruction of desire, hatred, and delusion.

original: nirmitakā prāhuḥ kiṃ punarāyuṣmatā rāgadveṣamohāḥ saṃvidyante yāṃ kṣapayiṣyatha /
analyzed: prāhuḥ kim punar āyuṣmatā rāga dveṣa mohāḥ saṃvidyante yām kṣapayiṣyatha
translated: The emanations said: But do you have desire, hatred, and delusion that you will destroy?

original: te āhu /
analyzed: te āhuḥ
translated: They said:

original: na te ādhyātmena na bahirdhā nobhayam antareṇopalabhyante /
analyzed: na te ādhyātmena na bahirdhā na ubhayam antareṇa upalabhyante
translated: They are not perceived internally, externally, or in between the two.

original: nāpi te aparikalpitā utpadyante nirmitakāv avocatā /
analyzed: na api te a parikalpitāḥ utpadyante nirmitakau a vocatā
translated: And they do not arise without conceptualization. The emanations said:

original: tena māyuṣmanto māsmān kalpayataḥ māsman vikalpayataḥ yadāyuṣmanto na kalpayiṣyathaḥ
analyzed: tena mā āyuṣmantaḥ mā asmān kalpayataḥ mā asman vikalpayataḥ yat āyuṣmantaḥ na kalpayiṣyathaḥ
translated: Therefore, venerable ones, do not conceptualize us, do not discriminate us. When, venerable ones, you do not conceptualize,

original: na vikalpayiṣyathaḥ tadāyuṣmanto na raṅkṣyatha na viraṅkṣyathaḥ yaścāyuṣmanto na
analyzed: na vikalpayiṣyathaḥ tadā āyuṣmantaḥ na raṅkṣyatha na viraṅkṣyathaḥ yaḥ ca āyuṣmantaḥ na
translated: You will not discriminate, venerable friends, you will not be attached, you will not be unattached. And, venerable friends, he who is neither attached nor unattached,

original: rakto na viraktaḥ / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / śānta ityucyate /
analyzed: raktaḥ na viraktaḥ śāntaḥ iti ucyate
translated: he is said to be peaceful.

original: KP / śīlam āyuṣmanto na saṃsarati na parinirvāti samādhiprajñāvimuktivimuktijñānadarśanam āyuṣ / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / na saṃsarati na parinirvāti
analyzed: śīlam āyuṣmantaḥ na saṃsarati na parinirvāti samādhi prajñā vimukti vimukti jñāna darśanam āyuḥ na saṃsarati na parinirvāti
translated: Morality, venerable friends, does not transmigrate, nor does it attain final nirvāṇa. Concentration, wisdom, liberation, and the knowledge and vision of liberation, venerable friends, do not transmigrate, nor do they attain final nirvāṇa.

original: ebhiścevāyuṣmanto dharmai nirvāṇaṃ sūcyate /
analyzed: ebhiḥ ca iva āyuṣmantaḥ dharmaiḥ nirvāṇam sūcyate
translated: And, venerable friends, nirvāṇa is indicated by these dharmas.

original: ete ca dharmā śūnyā viviktā agrā / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / prajahīte tāmāyuṣmantaḥ sañjñā
analyzed: ete ca dharmā śūnyā viviktā agrā prajahīte tām āyuṣmantaḥ sañjñā
translated: And these dharmas are empty, secluded, and foremost.

original: yaduta parinirvāṇam iti mā ca sañjñāyā sañjñā kārṣvaḥ mā asañjñāyā / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / /
analyzed: yat uta parinirvāṇam iti mā ca sañjñāyā sañjñā kārṣvaḥ mā a sañjñāyā
translated: Abandon that perception, venerable friends, namely, final nirvāṇa. Do not perceive perception as perception, do not perceive non-perception as non-perception.

original: ca sañjñayā sañjñā parijñāsiṣva /
analyzed: ca sañjñayā sañjñā parijñāsiṣva
translated: Perceive perception as perception.

original: yaḥ sañjñayā sañjñā parijānāti sañjñābandhanam evāsya tad bhavati /
analyzed: yaḥ sañjñayā sañjñāḥ parijānāti sañjñā bandhanam eva asya tat bhavati
translated: One who perceives perception as perception has that as his bondage.

original: saṃ / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / vedayitanirodhasamā pattimāyuṣmantaḥ samāpadyadhvaṃ mā ca kalpayatha
analyzed: sam vedayita nirodha samā āpattim āyuṣmantaḥ samāpadyadhvam mā ca kalpayatha
translated: Enter into the attainment of the cessation of perception and feeling, venerable friends, but do not conceptualize.

translated: They said, He who has arisen...

original: KP / subhūtirāha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhuti said:

original: kasya yuṣme śrāvakā kasya sakāśādyuṣme vinītā te āhuryena na prāptanābhisaṃ / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / subhūtirāha /
analyzed: kasya yuṣme śrāvakā kasya sakāśāt yuṣme vinītā te āhuḥ yena na subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Whose disciples are you? From whom have you been trained? They said, By him who has not attained, who has not realized...🔽Subhuti said:

original: kasya sakāśādyuṣmākaṃ dharmaṃ śrutaṃ /
analyzed: kasya sakāśāt yuṣmākam dharmam śrutam
translated: From whom have you heard the Dharma?

original: te āhu yasya na skandhā na dhātavo nāyatanāni subhūtirāha /
analyzed: te āhuḥ yasya na skandhāḥ na dhātavaḥ na āyatanāni subhūtiḥ āha
translated: They said, From him who has no aggregates, no elements, no sense bases. Subhuti said:

original: kathaṃ punaryuṣme dharmaṃ śrutaṃ /
analyzed: katham punar yuṣme dharmam śrutam
translated: But how have you heard the Dharma?

original: te āhurna bandhanāya na mokṣāya /
analyzed: te āhuḥ na bandhanāya na mokṣāya
translated: They said, Not for bondage, not for liberation.

original: subhūtirāha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhuti said:

original: kathaṃ yūyaṃ pra / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / ktā te āhu /
analyzed: katham yūyam pra ktā te āhu
translated: How have you been trained? They said:

original: na yogāya na prayogāya /
analyzed: na yogāya na prayogāya
translated: Not for union, not for application.

original: na prahāṇāya /
analyzed: na prahāṇāya
translated: Not for abandonment.

original: subhūtirāha kena yūyaṃ vinītāḥ te āhuḥ yasya na kāyapāriniṣpattirna cittapracāraṃ /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha kena yūyam vinītāḥ te āhuḥ yasya na kāya pāriniṣpattiḥ na citta pracāram
translated: Subhuti said: By whom have you been trained? They said, By him who has no bodily perfection, no mental activity.

original: subhūtirāha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhuti said:

original: kathaṃ yuṣmābhi prayujyamānā vimuktāḥ / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / āhuḥ nāvidyaprabāṇāya na vidyotpādāya
analyzed: katham yuṣmābhi prayujyamānāḥ vimuktāḥ āhuḥ na avidyā prabāṇāya na vidyā utpādāya
translated: How have you been liberated while practicing? They said, Not for the destruction of ignorance, not for the production of knowledge.

original: KP / subhūtirāha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhuti said:

original: kasya yūyaṃ śrāvakāḥ te āhuḥ yasya na prāpto nā / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / sambuddhaḥ subhūtirāha /

translated: To whom are you disciples? They replied, To him who has not attained, who has not known, who has not realized, who has not fully awakened to anything.🔽 Subhūti said, How long will it be before you attain final nirvāṇa? They replied, As long as the magically created beings of the Tathāgata will attain final nirvāṇa, for that long we will attain final nirvāṇa.🔽 Subhūti said, Have you done what had to be done?

original: keva cirena yūyaṃ parinirvāsyathaḥ tāhuḥ yāvaccireṇa tathāgatanirmi / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / kāḥ parinirvāsyanti tā vaccireṇa vayaṃ parinirvāsyāmaḥ
analyzed: keva cirena yūyam parinirvāsyathaḥ tāhuḥ yāvat cireṇa parinirvāsyanti tāḥ vat cireṇa vayam parinirvāsyāmaḥ
translated: They replied, We have done what had to be done.

original: subhūtirāha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said, Have you laid aside the burden?🔽 They replied, The burden is non-apprehensible.🔽 Subhūti said, Have you accomplished your own goal?🔽 They replied, The goal is non-apprehensible.🔽 Subhūti said, Have you done what had to be done?🔽 They replied, The doer is non-apprehensible.

original: kṛtaṃ yuṣmābhi svakārtha / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / te āhuḥ arthānupalabdhatvāt subhūtirāha /
analyzed: kṛtam yuṣmābhiḥ svaka artha te āhuḥ artha anupalabdha tvāt subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said, Have you laid aside the burden?🔽 They replied, The burden is non-apprehensible.

original: kṛtaṃ yuṣmābhiḥ karaṇīya /
analyzed: kṛtam yuṣmābhiḥ karaṇīya
translated: Subhūti said, Have you accomplished your own goal?

original: te āhu /🔽kārakānupa / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / bdhitvāt /🔽subhūtirāha /
analyzed: te āhuḥ  kāraka an upa bdhi tvāt  subhūtiḥ āha
translated: They replied, The goal is non-apprehensible.

original: keva yuṣmākaṃ sabrahmacāriṇa /🔽te āhuḥ /
analyzed: kā iva yuṣmākam sabrahmacāriṇaḥ  te āhuḥ
translated: Subhūti said, Who are your companions in the celibate life?

original: ye traidhātuke nopa caranti /
analyzed: ye traidhātuke na upa caranti
translated: They replied, Those who do not engage in the three realms.🔽 Subhūti said, Where will you attain final nirvāṇa?

original: na pracaraṃ / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / /🔽KP / subhūtirāha /
analyzed: na pracaram  subhūtiḥ āha
translated: They replied, Where the nature of phenomena has no final nirvāṇa.🔽 Subhūti said, Have you exhausted the defilements?🔽 They replied, All phenomena are utterly exhausted.🔽 Subhūti said, Have you laid aside the burden?

original: kṣīṇā yūṣmākaṃ kleśāḥ te āhuratyantakṣayatvāt sarvadharmāṇāṃ subhūtirāha /
analyzed: kṣīṇāḥ yūṣmākam kleśāḥ te āhuḥ atyanta kṣaya tvāt sarva dharmāṇām
translated: They replied, The burden is non-apprehensible.🔽 Subhūti said, Have you accomplished your own goal?🔽 They replied, The goal is non-apprehensible.🔽 Subhūti said, Have you done what had to be done?🔽 They replied, The doer is non-apprehensible.

original: dharṣitā yu / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / r māraḥ te āhuḥ skandhamārānupalabdhitvāt /
analyzed: dharṣitā māraḥ te āhuḥ skandha māra anupalabdhi tvāt
translated: You have been oppressed by Mara. They said, Because we do not perceive the aggregates as Mara.

original: subhūtirāha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhuti said:🔽You have attended on the Tathagata. They said, With the body, not with the mind.

original: paricīrṇo yuṣmābhistathāgataḥ te āhuḥ / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / kāyena na cittena subhūtirāha /
analyzed: paricīrṇaḥ yuṣmābhiḥ tathāgataḥ te āhuḥ kāyena na cittena subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhuti said:🔽You have stood on the stage of the Dakinis. They said, Because of non-grasping, non-attachment, and non-perception.

original: sthitā yuṣmākaṃ dākṣīṇeyabhūmauḥ te āhuḥ agrāhataḥ a / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / tigrāhataḥ subhūtirāha /
analyzed: sthitā yuṣmākam dākṣīṇeya bhūmauḥ te āhuḥ agrāhataḥ a tigrāhataḥ subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhuti said:

original: cchinnā yūyaṃ saṃsāraṃ /
analyzed: chinnāḥ yūyam saṃsāram
translated: You have cut off samsara.🔽They said, Because of non-annihilation and non-eternality.

original: te āhuḥ anuccheda aśāśvatatvāt subhūtirāha /
analyzed: te āhuḥ anuccheda aśāśvata tvāt subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhuti said:

original: pratipannā yūyaṃ śramaṇaśramaṇabhūmau /
analyzed: pratipannāḥ yūyam śramaṇa śramaṇa bhūmau
translated: You have entered the stage of ascetics and brahmins.

original: tena punarāhuḥ asaṅgāvimuktau /🔽subhūtirā / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / kigāmināyuṣmantaḥ te āhuḥryadgaminastathāgatanirmitāḥ //
analyzed: tena punar āhuḥ asaṅga avimuktau  subhūtiḥ ā ki gāminā āyuṣmantaḥ te āhuḥ yad gaminaḥ tathāgata nirmitāḥ
translated: They said, Because of non-attachment and non-liberation.🔽Subhuti said:🔽Where are you going, venerable sirs? They said, Where the emanations of the Tathagata go.

original: KP / iti hyāyuṣmantaḥ subhūti paripṛcchataḥ teṣā / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / bhikṣūṇāṃ visarjayantānāṃ /
analyzed: iti hi āyuṣmantaḥ subhūti paripṛcchataḥ teṣām bhikṣūṇām visarjayantānām
translated: Thus, venerable sirs, when Subhuti asked and those monks answered,

original: tasyā parṣadi aṣṭānāṃ bhikṣuśatānāṃ pañcānāṃ ca bhikṣuṇīśatānām anupādāya / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / vebhyaścittāni vimuktāni /
analyzed: tasyāḥ parṣadi aṣṭānām bhikṣu śatānām pañcānām ca bhikṣuṇī śatānām an upādāya vebhyaḥ cittāni vimuktāni
translated: In that assembly, the minds of eight hundred monks and five hundred nuns were liberated from the defilements without further clinging.

original: dvātriṃśatīnāṃ ca prāṇasahasrāṇāṃ sadevamānuṣikāyāṃ prajāyām virajo vigata / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / dharmeṣu dharmacakṣurviśuddham //
analyzed: dvātriṃśatīnām ca prāṇa sahasrāṇām sa deva mānuṣikāyām prajāyām virajaḥ vigata dharmeṣu dharma cakṣuḥ viśuddham
translated: And thirty-two thousand beings, both human and divine, attained the pure and spotless Dharma-eye.

original: KP / atha khalu samantāloko nāma bodhisattvo mahāsattvo bhagavantametad avocat
analyzed: atha khalu samantālokaḥ nāma bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva named Samantāvabhāsa said this to the Blessed One:

original: i / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / gavan mahāratnakūṭe dharmaparyāye śikṣitukāmena bodhisattvena
analyzed: i gavat mahāratnakūṭe dharmaparyāye śikṣitu kāmena bodhisattvena
translated: Blessed One, a bodhisattva who wishes to train in the Mahāratnakūṭa Dharma discourse

original: kathaṃ sthātavyaṃ kathaṃ pratipattavyaṃ /
analyzed: katham sthātavyam katham pratipattavyam
translated: should stand how, should practice how,🔽should train how?

original: kathaṃ śikṣitavyaṃ / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / vānāha /
analyzed: katham śikṣitavyam
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: udgṛhya kulaputra iha dharmaparyāye śikṣā ākhyātā pratipattisārāṇāṃ satpuruṣāṇām iyaṃ dharmaparyāyo bhavārthakaro bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: udgṛhya kula putra iha dharmaparyāye śikṣā ākhyātā pratipatti sārāṇām sat puruṣāṇām iyam dharmaparyāyaḥ bhava artha karaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Noble sir, having taken up this Dharma discourse, the training has been taught for those who value practice, for good people. This Dharma discourse will be beneficial.

original: KP / tadyathāpi nāma kulaputra kaścideva puruṣaḥ mṛnmayīnāvabhiruhyaṃ gaṅgānadīm uttartukāmo bhavet /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kula putra kaścid eva puruṣaḥ mṛd mayīnau abhiruhyam gaṅgā nadīm uttartu kāmaḥ bhavet
translated: Just as, noble sir, if some man were to board a clay boat and wish to cross the Ganges River,🔽 What do you think, noble sir, with what kind of effort should that man row the boat?

original: tatkiṃ manyase kulaputra kīdṛśena vīryeṇa tena puruṣeṇa sā nnorvāhayitavyā bhave / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / ha balavatā bhagavan vīryeṇa /
analyzed: tat kim manyase kula putra kīdṛśena vīryeṇa tena puruṣeṇa sā nnoḥ vāhayitavyā bhave ha balavatā bhagavan vīryeṇa
translated: Blessed One, with great effort.

original: tatkasmāddhetoḥ mā measamprāptapārasyevāntareṇa nnaurvipadyeta /🔽mahāo / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / rṇavaprāpto smin mā haivāntareṇāyaṃ nāvā vikīryeta /🔽bhagavān āha /
analyzed: tat kasmāt hetoḥ mā mea samprāpta pārasya iva antareṇa nnauḥ vipadyeta  mahā ṛṇava prāptaḥ smin mā ha eva antareṇa ayam nāvā vikīryeta  bhagavān āha
translated: Why is that? So that, before reaching the other shore, the boat does not break apart in the middle.

original: evameva samantāloka ato bahutare / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / balavantatareṇa vīryeṇa bodhisattvena
analyzed: evam eva samantāloka atas bahutare balavantatareṇa vīryeṇa bodhisattvena
translated: The Blessed One said, Just so, Samantaprabhāsa, with even greater effort, with even greater strength,

original: bodhiḥ samudānayitavyāḥ mahābalavīryeṇa ca buddhadharmā samudānayita / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / /
analyzed: bodhiḥ samudānayitavyāḥ mahā bala vīryeṇa ca buddha dharmā
translated: the bodhisattva should strive for enlightenment, and with great strength and effort, for the attainment of the Buddha qualities.

original: KP / evamanasīkāreṇa anityo batāyaṃ kāyaḥ caturmahābhūtikaḥ mātāpitṛkalalasambhūta /
analyzed: evamanasīkāreṇa anityaḥ bata ayam kāyaḥ catur mahābhūtikaḥ mātā pitṛ kalala sambhūta
translated: Thus, with this attitude, 'This body is impermanent, made of the four great elements, born of mother and father, produced by eating,

original: adhru / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / nāśvāsikaḥ vipariṇāmadharmaḥ ucchadasnapanaparimardanabhedanavikiraṇavidhvaṃsanadharmaḥ🔽oda / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / lmāsopacitaḥ acirasthāyi anāhāro na tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: vipariṇāma dharmaḥ ucchada snapana parimardana bhedana vikiraṇa vidhvaṃsana dharmaḥ  anāhāraḥ na tiṣṭhati
translated: accumulated from food, not lasting long, not remaining without eating.

original: jarjaragṛhasadṛśo durabalaḥ mā haiva anādattasā / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / syāntareṇa
analyzed: jarjara gṛha sadṛśaḥ durabalaḥ mā ha eva an ādattasā sya antareṇa
translated: Like an old house, fragile, lest I should die in the interval without having attained the other shore,

original: kālakriyā bhaviṣyati mahoghārṇavaprāpto 'smi caturottararogaśataprāptānāṃ sattvānām
analyzed: kālakriyā bhaviṣyati mahā ogha arṇava prāptaḥ smi catur uttara roga śata prāptānām sattvānām
translated: having reached the great ocean of death, for the sake of beings who have reached the four hundred and four diseases,

original: uhyamāna / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / m uttāraṇatāyā bodhisattvena mahādharmanāvaṃ samudānayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: uhyamāna uttāraṇa tāyāḥ bodhisattvena mahā dharma nāvam samudānayiṣyāmi
translated: I, the Bodhisattva, will gather the great Dharma ship for the sake of rescuing those who are drowning in the ocean of existence,

original: yayā dharmanāvā sarvasattvā saṃsār / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / vaprāptān uhyamānān uttārayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: yayā dharma nāvā sarva sattvā uhyamānān uttārayiṣyāmi
translated: with that Dharma ship I will rescue all beings who have reached the ocean of existence, who are drowning, and who are being carried away.

original: KP / tatra samantāloka kīdṛśe dharmanau bodhisatvasya samudānayi / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / /
analyzed: tatra samantāloka kīdṛśe dharmanau bodhisatvasya
translated: In that regard, Samantagupta, what kind of Dharma ship should the Bodhisattva gather?

original: iha samantāloka bodhisattvena dharmanāvā samudānayitavyā yaduta sarvasamacittasambhārā / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / /🔽vanti anantapuṇyopacitā śīlaphalanirjātā dānaparivārālaṅkārālaṅkṛtāḥ āśayadṛḍhasārab / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / /
analyzed: iha samantāloka bodhisattvena dharma nāvā samudānayitavyā yat uta sarva sama citta sambhārā  vanti ananta puṇya upacitā śīla phala nirjātāḥ dāna parivāra alaṅkāra alaṅkṛtāḥ āśaya dṛḍha sāra b
translated: Here, Samantajñāna Bodhisattva, you should build the ship of Dharma, which is the accumulation of the mind of equality towards all, the accumulation of the mind of great compassion, the accumulation of the mind of great love, the accumulation of the mind of great joy, and the accumulation of the mind of equanimity towards all. You should build the ship of Dharma with these.🔽You should build the ship of Dharma with the provisions of the mind of great compassion, the provisions of the mind of great love, the provisions of the mind of great joy, and the provisions of the mind of equanimity towards all. You should build the ship of Dharma with these.🔽You should build the ship of Dharma with the provisions of the mind of great compassion, the provisions of the mind of great love, the provisions of the mind of great joy, and the provisions of the mind of equanimity towards all. You should build the ship of Dharma with these.

original: nasubaddhāḥ kṣāntisoratyasmṛtiśalyabaddhāḥ saptabodhyaṅgasambhāradṛḍhavīryakuśaladharmadārusamudānitā🔽dhyān / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / ttakramanīyakarmaṇikṛtāḥ dāntāśāntājāneyakuśalaśilpasuniṣṭhitā /
analyzed: na su baddhāḥ kṣānti so ratya smṛti śalya baddhāḥ sapta bodhyaṅga sambhāra dṛḍha vīrya kuśala dharma dāru samudāni tā  dānta aśānta jāneya kuśala śilpa su niṣṭhitā
translated: You should build the ship of Dharma with the provisions of the mind of great compassion, the provisions of the mind of great love, the provisions of the mind of great joy, and the provisions of the mind of equanimity towards all. You should build the ship of Dharma with these.🔽You should build the ship of Dharma with the provisions of the mind of great compassion, the provisions of the mind of great love, the provisions of the mind of great joy, and the provisions of the mind of equanimity towards all. You should build the ship of Dharma with these.🔽You should build the ship of Dharma with the provisions of the mind of great compassion, the provisions of the mind of great love, the provisions of the mind of great joy, and the provisions of the mind of equanimity towards all. You should build the ship of Dharma with these.

original: atyantākopyadharma mahākaruṇāsaṅgṛhī / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / catuḥsaṅgrahavastuśūraturagavāhinī pratyarthikaprajñājñānasupratirakṣitā /
analyzed: atyanta a kopya dharma mahā karuṇā saṅgṛhī catur saṅgraha vastu śūra turaga vāhinī pratyarthika prajñā jñāna su pratirakṣitā
translated: You should build the ship of Dharma with the provisions of the mind of great compassion, the provisions of the mind of great love, the provisions of the mind of great joy, and the provisions of the mind of equanimity towards all. You should build the ship of Dharma with these.

original: upāyakauśalyasukṛtavic / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / catubrahmavihārasuśodhitāṃ /🔽KP / catusmṛtyupasthānasucintitakāyopanītā /
analyzed: upāya kauśalya sukṛta vid catu brahmavihāra su śodhitām 🔽catu smṛti upasthāna su cintita kāya upanītā
translated: You should build the ship of Dharma with the provisions of the mind of great compassion, the provisions of the mind of great love, the provisions of the mind of great joy, and the provisions of the mind of equanimity towards all. You should build the ship of Dharma with these.

original: samyakprahāṇaprasaṭhāri / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / dajavajavitā /
translated: The one who has well-abandoned the enemies, the one who has the speed of the wind,

original: indriyasunirīkṣitadānavakravigata balavegasamudgatā antareṇa śithilabodhyaṅgavibodha / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / ariśatrumārapathajahanī mānokramavāhinī🔽kutirthyatīrthajahanī /
analyzed: indriya su nirīkṣita dāna vakra vigata bala vega samudgatā antareṇa śithila bodhyaṅga vibodha ari śatru māra patha jahanī māna ukrama vāhinī  kutirthya tīrtha jahanī
translated: The one who has well-examined the faculties, the one who is free from crookedness, the one who has arisen with the impetus of strength, the one who is not lax in the middle in arousing the factors of awakening, the one who is free from laziness, the one who is free from the path of enemies, the one who carries the pride of victory,🔽The one who abandons the fords of the non-Buddhists.

original: śamathaniddhyaptinirdiṣṭā vipaśyanāpra / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / gā /
analyzed: śamatha niddhi apti nirdiṣṭāḥ vipaśyanā pra
translated: The one who is directed towards tranquility and insight,

original: ubhayorantayorasaktavāhinī /
analyzed: ubhayoḥ antayoḥ asakta vāhinī
translated: The one who carries without attachment to the two extremes,

original: hetudharmayuktā vipulvistīrṇākṣayaprahāṇābandhā vighuṣṭaśabdā daśa / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / kṣu śabdam ādāyatyāgacchatāgacchatābhiruta mahādharmanāvaṃ
analyzed: hetu dharma yuktāḥ vipul vistīrṇāḥ a kṣaya prahāṇa ābandhāḥ vighuṣṭa śabdāḥ daśa śabdam ādāya tya āgacchata āgacchata abhiḥ uta mahā dharma nāvam
translated: The one who is endowed with the Dharma of causes, the one who is vast and extensive, the one who is inexhaustible in abandoning bonds, the one whose fame is proclaimed, the one who has taken up the sound of the ten, the one who is coming, coming, the one who is calling out, the one who is carrying the great Dharma ship,

original: nirvāṇapuragāminī /
analyzed: nirvāṇa pura gāminī
translated: The one who goes to the city of nirvana,

original: kṣemamārgagāminī /🔽mahā / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / matīra satkāyadṛṣṭiṃ jahanīṃ /
analyzed: kṣema mārga gāminī  satkāyadṛṣṭim jahanīm
translated: The one who goes on the path of safety,🔽The one who is carrying the great, the one who abandons the view of the transitory collection,

original: parimatīragāminī laghusarvadṛṣṭigatavigatāṃ /
analyzed: parima tīra gāminī laghu sarva dṛṣṭi gata vigatām
translated: The one who goes to the other shore, the one who is quick in abandoning all views,

original: KP / īdṛśi kulaputra dharma / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / bodhisattvena samudānayitavyaḥ aparimāṇakalpakoṭīnayutaśatasahasraparikhinnamānasena
analyzed: īdṛśi kula putra dharma bodhisattvena samudānayitavyaḥ aparimāṇa kalpa koṭī nayuta śata sahasra parikhinna mānasena
translated: In this way, son of noble family, the bodhisattva should practice the Dharma, with a mind not weary of accumulating merit for immeasurable quintillions of eons, thinking, I will liberate all beings from the ocean of old age, sickness, and death, and establish them in the deathless state of nirvāṇa.

original: rvasattvānāmarthāya anayā saddharmanāvā sarvasattvā tārayitavyāḥ
analyzed: rva sattvānām arthāya anayā saddharma nāvā sarva sattvāḥ tārayitavyāḥ
translated: For the sake of all beings, I will ferry across all beings with this ship of the true Dharma.

original: caturbhiroghe uhyamānāḥ īdṛ / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / nāvā kulaputra bodhisattvena samudānayitavyāḥ
analyzed: caturbhiḥ oghe uhyamānāḥ nāvā kula putra bodhisattvena samudānayitavyāḥ
translated: Those who are being carried away by the four rivers, son of noble family, the bodhisattva should practice the Dharma in this way, with a ship like this.

original: tatra samantālokaḥ katāmā bodhisattvasya kṣiprābhijñatā /
analyzed: tatra samanta ālokaḥ kata amā bodhisattvasya kṣipra abhijña tā
translated: There, Samantajñāna, what is the bodhisattva's swift higher knowledge?

original: yaduta akṛ / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / maḥ prayogaḥ sarvasattveṣu /
analyzed: yat uta akṛ maḥ prayogaḥ sarva sattveṣu
translated: Namely, the practice of non-action towards all beings.

original: tīvracchandikatā ācayaśuddhyā /
analyzed: tīvra chandika tā ācaya śuddhyā
translated: Intense aspiration through the purity of accumulation.🔽Intense effort through the accumulation of all roots of merit.

original: utaptavīryatā sarvakuśalamūlasamudānaya / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / ye kuśalacchandikatā yoniśamanasikāreṇa śrutatṛptatā /
analyzed: utapta vīrya tā sarva kuśala mūla samudānaya ye kuśala chandika tā yoni śama nasikāreṇa śruta tṛpta tā
translated: Intense aspiration through proper mental attention. Satisfaction through learning.

original: prajñāparipūryaiḥ nirmānatā prajñopa / / / / / / / / ya /
analyzed: prajñā paripūryaiḥ nirmāna tā
translated: Humility for the sake of fulfilling wisdom.

original: pravrajyānimnatāi /
analyzed: pravrajyā nimna tā
translated: Inclination towards renunciation.

original: sarvaguṇaparipūryai araṇyavāsaḥ kāyacittavivekatayā /
analyzed: sarva guṇa paripūryai araṇya vāsaḥ kāya citta viveka tayā
translated: Dwelling in the forest, for the sake of the seclusion of body and mind, for the perfection of all good qualities.

original: KP / asaṃsargo durja / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / navivarjanatayā /
analyzed: a saṃsargaḥ
translated: Non-association, for the sake of avoiding bad associates.

original: dharmārthikatā paramārthārthapratisaraṇatayā /
analyzed: dharma arthika tā paramārtha artha pratisaraṇa tayā
translated: Seeking the Dharma, for the sake of taking refuge in the ultimate truth.

original: jñānārtho tyantakopanārthatayā /
analyzed: tyanta kopana artha tayā
translated: Seeking knowledge, for the sake of the ultimate destruction of afflictions.

original: dharmā / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / nārthatayā /🔽satyārtho avisaṃvādanārthatayā /🔽śunyatārtho samyakprayogārthatayā /
analyzed: dharmāḥ na artha tayā  satya arthaḥ a visaṃvādana artha tayā  samyak prayoga artha tayā
translated: Seeking the Dharma, for the sake of the Dharma.🔽Seeking truth, for the sake of non-deception.🔽Seeking emptiness, for the sake of right practice.

original: vivekārtho atyantopa / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / rthatāyeti //
analyzed: viveka arthaḥ
translated: Seeking seclusion, for the sake of ultimate peace.

original: iyamucyate samantāloka bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya kṣiprābhijñatā //
analyzed: iyam ucyate samantāloka bodhisattvasya mahāsattvasya kṣipra abhijña tā
translated: This is called the bodhisattva-mahāsattva's swift supernormal knowledge of universal illumination.

original: KP / atha khalvāyuṣmān mahākāśyapo bhagavantametadavocat āścāryaṃ bhagavan /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān mahākāśyapaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat āścāryam bhagavan
translated: Then the Venerable Mahākāśyapa said to the Blessed One: It is wonderful, Blessed One!

original: aścāryaṃ sugataḥ yāvacceyaṃ mahāratnakūṭo sūtrāntarā / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / upakārībhūto mahāyānasamprasthitānāṃ kulaputrāṇāṃ ca kuladuhitṛṇāṃ 🔽ca /
analyzed: aścāryam sugataḥ yāvat ca iyam mahā ratnakūṭaḥ sūtra antarā upakārībhūtaḥ mahāyāna samprasthitānām kula putrāṇām ca kula duhitṛṇām 🔽ca
translated: It is wonderful, Sugata! This Mahāratnakūṭa Sūtra is so very helpful for the sons and daughters of good family who have set out in the Great Vehicle.

original: kiyadbhagavan sa kulaputro / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / kuladuhitā vā puṇyaṃ prasavati /
analyzed: kiyat bhagavan sa kula putraḥ kula duhitā vā puṇyam prasavati
translated: Blessed One, how much merit does that son of a good family... generate?

original: ya ito ratnakūṭaṃ sūtrāntarājñādekagāthām apyupadiśet
analyzed: yaḥ itas ratnakūṭam sūtrānta rājñāt eka gāthām api upadiśet
translated: How much merit does that son of good family... generate, Blessed One, if he teaches even one verse from this Ratnakūṭa Sūtra?

original: KP / evamukte bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ mahākāśyapam etadavocat yo hi kāśyapa kulaputro
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavān āyuṣmantam mahākāśyapam etat avocat yaḥ hi kāśyapa kula putraḥ
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Mahākāśyapa, Kāśyapa, a son of good family or daughter of good family

original: vā kuladuhitā vā gaṅgānadīvālukasameṣu lokadhā / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / paramāṇuñjāsi
analyzed: vā kula duhitā vā gaṅgā nadī vāluka sameṣu lokadhā
translated: who would crush as many world systems as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River into atoms,

original: bindeya bhitvā tāttakā caiva vārāvāpeya /
analyzed: ca eva
translated: and scatter those atoms,

original: tāttakā caiva taṃ sarvalokadhātavaḥ sa / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / paripūrṇaṃ kṛtvā tathāgatebhyo 'rhadbhyaḥ samayaksambuddhebhyo dānaṃ dadyāt /
analyzed: tāttakā ca eva tam sarva lokadhātavaḥ sa paripūrṇam kṛtvā tathāgatebhyaḥ rhadbhyaḥ samayaksambuddhebhyaḥ dānam dadyāt
translated: and fill up all those world systems with the seven precious substances, and give them as a gift to the Tathāgatas, the Arhats, the Perfectly Awakened Ones,

original: gaṅgānadīvālukasamānāṃ ca buddhā / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / bhagavantānām ekekasya ca tathāgatasya gaṅgānadīvālukāsamān vihārān karāpayet /
analyzed: gaṅgā nadī vāluka samānām ca buddhāḥ bhagavantānām ekekasya ca tathāgatasya gaṅgā nadī vālukā samān vihārān karāpayet
translated: and build monasteries for as many Buddhas, Blessed Ones, as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River, for each Tathāgata,

original: KP / gaṅgānadīvā / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / mānāṃ ca buddhānāṃ bhagavatām ekekaṃ ca tathāgatasyāprameyaśrāvakasaṅghaṃ
analyzed: ca buddhānām bhagavatām ekekam ca tathāgatasya aprameya śrāvaka saṅgham
translated: and the assemblies of disciples of each Tathāgata, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River,

original: gaṅgānadīvālukāsamān kalpāṃ / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / sukhopadhānaiḥ paricaret /
analyzed: gaṅgā nadī vālukā samān sukha upadhānaiḥ paricaret
translated: and serve them with articles of happiness for eons equal to the sands of the Ganges River,

original: teṣām ca buddhānāṃ bhagavataṃ yāvajjīvamanāpena kāyakarmeṇa vākkarmeṇa m / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / /
analyzed: teṣām ca buddhānām bhagavatam yāvajjīvam anāpena kāya karmeṇa vāc karmeṇa
translated: and serve and attend upon those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, for as long as they live with unappealing bodily actions, speech, and mind,🔽and those worlds equal to the sands of the Ganges River, having split them into atoms,

original: rmeṇa upasthānaparicaryāya tāttakā caiva gaṅgānadīvālukāsamāṃ lokadhātavaḥ paramāṇurajāṃsi🔽ttakābhidya bhitvā vā tāttakā caiva vārāpeya /🔽tān sarvaṃ lokadhātuḥ saptaratnaparipūrṇaṃ kṛtvā / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / naṃ dadyādbuddhānāṃ
analyzed: upasthāna paricaryāya ca eva gaṅgā nadī vālukā samām lokadhātavaḥ paramāṇu rajāṃsi  vā tāttakā ca eva vārāpeya  tān sarvam lokadhātuḥ sapta ratna paripūrṇam kṛtvā nam dadyāt buddhānām
translated: and those worlds equal to the sands of the Ganges River, having split them into atoms, and having made them all into worlds filled with the seven precious things,🔽and give them to the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones,

original: bhagavatāṃ yāvajjīvaṃ ca manapena kāya karmaṇā vākkarmaṇā manaskarmaṇā upa / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / /
analyzed: bhagavatām yāvajjīvam ca manapena kāya karmaṇā vāc karmaṇā manaḥ karmaṇā upa
translated: and serve and attend upon them with unappealing bodily actions, speech, and mind for as long as they live,🔽and the merit from that, and the merit from the perfection of giving, and the merit from the perfection of morality, and the merit from the perfection of patience, and the merit from the perfection of effort, and the merit from the perfection of meditation, and the merit from the perfection of wisdom, and the merit from the perfection of skillful means, and the merit from the perfection of vows, and the merit from the perfection of power, and the merit from the perfection of knowledge, and the merit from the perfection of compassion, and the merit from the perfection of great compassion, and the merit from the perfection of the four means of gathering students, and the merit from the perfection of the four immeasurables, and the merit from the perfection of the four dhyānas, and the merit from the perfection of the four formless concentrations, and the merit from the perfection of the five higher knowledges, and the merit from the perfection of the six perfections, and the merit from the perfection of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment, and the merit from the perfection of the three gateways to liberation, and the merit from the perfection of the ten powers of the Tathāgata, and the merit from the perfection of the four forms of fearlessness, and the merit from the perfection of the four forms of unobstructed knowledge, and the merit from the perfection of the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha, and the merit from the perfection of the thirty-two major marks of a great man, and the merit from the perfection of the eighty minor marks, and the merit from the perfection of the thirty-two major marks of a great man, and the merit from the perfection of the eighty minor marks, and

original: pāricaryāya tāttakā caiva gaṅgānadīvālukāsamān api tāttakā caiva buddhānāṃ bhagavataṃ🔽satkuryād / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / n mānayet pūjayet teṣāṃ ca parinirvṛtānāṃ
analyzed: pāricaryāya tāttakā ca eva gaṅgā nadī vālukā samān api tāttakā ca eva buddhānām bhagavatam  satkuryāt n mānayet pūjayet teṣām ca parinirvṛtānām
translated: honor, venerate, and make offerings to that many Blessed Buddhas,

original: saptaratnamayā stupā kārāpayet /
analyzed: sapta ratna mayā stupā kārāpayet
translated: and would build stūpas made of the seven precious substances for them after their parinirvāṇa,

original: yaśca kulaputro vā kula / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / tā vā ito mahāratnakūṭāt sūtrāntarājñā
analyzed: yaḥ ca kula putraḥ vā itas mahā ratna kūṭāt sūtrānta rājñā
translated: and if a son of good family or a daughter of good family would recite even one verse from this Great Heap of Jewels,🔽which is spoken by all the Buddhas, and would remember it,

original: sarvabuddhabhāṣitādekāmapi gāthā udgṛhṇeya dhāra / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / asya puṇyaskandhasya🔽sa pūrvakapuṇyaskandhaḥ śatimāmapi /
analyzed: sarva buddha bhāṣitāt ekām api gāthāḥ udgṛhṇeya asya puṇya skandhasya  sa pūrvaka puṇya skandhaḥ śatimām api
translated: the mass of merit from that

original: kalānopaiti /🔽sahasrimāmapi /
analyzed: kalān ā upaiti  sahasrimām api
translated: would not approach even a hundredth part of the previous mass of merit.🔽It would not approach even a thousandth part.🔽It would not approach even a hundred thousandth part.

original: ko / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / tasahasrimāmapi /🔽saṅkhyāmapi /🔽kalāmapi /
analyzed: kaḥ ta sahasrimām api  saṅkhyām api  kalām api
translated: It would not approach even a count,🔽a fraction,🔽a calculation,

original: gaṇanāmapi /
analyzed: gaṇanām api
translated: a simile,

original: upamāpi /🔽upaniṣāmapi /
analyzed: upamā api  upaniṣām api
translated: or an example.

original: nakṣa / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / yośca śruṇeya śrutvā ca na parikṣipeya /
analyzed: nakṣa yoḥ ca śruṇeya śrutvā ca na parikṣipeya
translated: And if one would hear it and, having heard it, would not reject it,

original: ayaṃ tato bahutaraḥ puṇyaskandhaprasuto bhavet /
analyzed: ayam tatas bahutaraḥ puṇya skandha prasutaḥ bhavet
translated: that would produce a mass of merit much greater than that.

original: yaśca mātṛ / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / /śṛṇuyād vā likhāpayed vā paryāpnuyād vā tasya na jātu vinipāto bhaviṣyati /🔽sa eva tasya paśe
analyzed: yaḥ ca mātṛ śṛṇuyāt vā likhāpayet vā paryāpnuyāt vā tasya na jātu vinipātaḥ bhaviṣyati  saḥ eva tasya paśe
translated: Whoever listens to this, or causes it to be written, or possesses it, will never fall into misfortune.

original: vo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: vaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: He will be like a son to me.

original: KP / yatra ca pṛthivīpradeśo ayaṃ ratnakūṭo dharmaparyāyo bhāṣyate vā deśyate vā
analyzed: yatra ca pṛthivī pradeśaḥ ayam ratna kūṭaḥ dharmaparyāyaḥ bhāṣyate vā deśyate vā
translated: Wherever this Ratnakūṭa Dharma discourse is spoken or taught,

original: likhyate vā / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / vā pustagataṃ vā tiṣṭhet sa pṛthivīpradeśe🔽caityabhūto sadevakasya lokasya yasya ca dharmabhāṇakasyānt / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / /
analyzed: likhyate vā vā pusta gatam vā tiṣṭhet sa pṛthivī pradeśe  sa devakasya lokasya yasya ca
translated: or is written or copied, or exists in the form of a book, that place

original: d imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ śriṇuyād vā udgṛhṇīyād vā likhed vā paryāpnuyād vā /
analyzed: d imam dharmaparyāyam śriṇuyāt vā udgṛhṇīyāt vā likhet vā paryāpnuyāt vā
translated: will be like a caitya, revered by the world including the gods, by whoever listens to, memorizes, writes, or possesses this Dharma discourse.🔽To that Dharma teacher,

original: tasya dharmabhāṇakasyāntike / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / vaṃrūpā gauravām utpādayitavyaḥ tadyathāpi nāma kāśyapa tathāgatasya /
analyzed: tasya dharmabhāṇakasya antike vaṃrūpā gauravām utpādayitavyaḥ tat yathā api nāma kāśyapa tathāgatasya
translated: one should generate respect as if towards the Tathāgata, O Kāśyapa.

original: y / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / /ṇakaṃ satkariṣyati gurukariṣyati mānayiṣyati /
analyzed: satkariṣyati gurukariṣyati mānayiṣyati
translated: will honor, respect, revere, and make offerings to them.

original: pūj / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / ṇakāle cāsya tathāgatadarśānaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ca asya tathāgata darśānam bhaviṣyati
translated: And at the right time, he will see the Tathāgata.🔽By seeing the Tathāgata, he will attain the ten purities of bodily action. What are the ten?

original: KP / tathāgatadarśanena ca daśa ca kāyakarmapāriśuddhi pratilap / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / katame daśa /
analyzed: tathāgata darśanena ca daśa ca kāya karma pāriśuddhi katame daśa
translated: Namely:

original: yaduta / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / /vedanāyā aparyādattacitta kālaṃ kariṣyati /🔽cakṣuvibhramaścāsya na bhaviṣyati / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / stavikṣepaṃ ca kariṣyati na pādavikṣepaṃ ca kariṣyati /
analyzed: yat uta vedanāyāḥ a paryādatta citta kālam kariṣyati  cakṣu vibhramaḥ ca asya na bhaviṣyati stavikṣepam ca kariṣyati na pāda vikṣepam ca kariṣyati
translated: he will die without his mind being disturbed by feelings.🔽He will not have confusion of the eyes.

original: noccāraṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: na uccāram kariṣyati
translated: He will not throw his arms about. He will not throw his legs about.

original: na prasrāvaṃ kariṣyati /🔽na / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / ātsvedaṃ prayariṣyati /
analyzed: na prasrāvam kariṣyati  na āt svedam prayariṣyati
translated: He will not defecate.🔽He will not urinate.🔽He will not sweat.

original: na muṣṭiṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: na muṣṭim kariṣyati
translated: He will not make a fist.

original: na cākāśaṃ parāmṛśati /
analyzed: na ca ākāśam parāmṛśati
translated: He will not touch the sky.

analyzed: yathā
translated: As he is sitting
